article_title: AT&T-DirecTV Deal Further Complicates Job of Regulators
article_text:
AT&T Inc.'s almost $49 billion deal to acquire DirecTV complicates the task of federal regulators, who must consider whether a wave of media-industry consolidation will harm consumers.

The transaction doesn't appear to pose a serious threat to competition outside of markets where AT&T already offers pay-TV service. But it comes amid a spate of telecom megamergers, including Comcast Corp.'s proposed acquisition of Time Warner...
